frameDefinitions: An Entity persists in a stable situation called a State
An Experiencer, Expressor, Event, or State has an emotion as brought on by an Stimulus or Topic.
A person (Speaker) expresses a Message or mental content, broadly understood, in a particular Manner.
The lexical units in this frame have to do with an Entity being in a State of order or disorder.
The Creator creates a new entity, the Created_entity, possibly out of Components.
frameExamples: He <t>arranged</t> the elements in the pattern that we now call the periodic table.
The <t>joyful</t> reunion took place on Sunday.
Soon the system was in total <t><fex name='St'>chaos</fex></t>.
The Libyans were <t>generating</t> arms for export.
listRoleDefinitions: The person who causes the <fen>Theme</fen> to be in a particular <fen>Configuration</fen>.
An entity that consists of  parts which can be put into a configuration relative to each other and/or relative to their environment.
A state that holds of the <fen>Theme</fen> or a relation that holds among the constituent parts of the <fen>Theme</fen> as a result of the arranging action.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the arranging takes place.
Concrete or abstract entity
State of an Entity.
The <fen>Experiencer</fen> is the person or sentient entity that experiences or feels the emotions.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the general area in which the emotion occurs.  It indicates a range of possible <fen>Stimulus</fen>.
The <fen>Stimulus</fen> is the person, event, or state of affairs that evokes the emotional response in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.

The body part, gesture, or other expression of the <fen>Experiencer</fen> that reflects his or her emotional state.  They describe a presentation of the experience or emotion denoted by the adjective or noun.
The <fen>State</fen> is the abstract noun that describes a more lasting experience by the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
The <fen>Event</fen> is the occasion or happening that <fen>Experiencer</fen>s in a certain emotional state participate in.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Experiencer</fen>, <fen>Expressor</fen>, <fen>Event</fen>, or <fen>State</fen> can be described as having said emotion.
<fen>Speaker</fen>, the person who encodes the <fen>Message</fen>, occurs as the External Argument of all the verbs:
The <fen>Message</fen> is almost invariably expressed in an NP Object. (The only exceptions occur with the verb <t>express</t>, which is occasionally used with that-clause complements.)

For most of the words in this frame, some expression of <fen>Manner</fen> or <fen>Medium</fen> is obligatory. As in other frames, <fen>Manner</fen> expressions characterize the action (in this case, the speech act performed by the <fen>Speaker</fen>). However, a wide range of <fen>Manner</fen> expressions occurs in this frame, including the following types:
<fen>Medium</fen> expresses the <fen>Medium</fen> of communication, such as the language used or the specific type of text in which the <fen>Message</fen> occurs:
The object or phenomenon which exists in the <fen>State</fen> of disorder.  It is common for the <fen>Entity</fen> to be null instantiated in this frame.
The <fen>State</fen> in which the <fen>Entity</fen> exists.  Usually the <fen>State</fen> will be the target-denoting noun.
The time at which the <fen>Entity</fen> exists in the <fen>State</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Entity</fen> exists in the <fen>State</fen>.
The Creator creates a created entity.
This role identifies the entity that the Agent intentionally creates.
This role identifes the Time when an Agent intentionally creates a new entity.
This role identifies the place ehere the Agent intentionally creates the new entity.
listRoleExamples: At Medicine Man's ragtime dance contest, a jubilant <fex>girl</fex> drove the crowd wild.
Earl is jubilant <fex>about his new swim trunks</fex>.
<fex>Putin’s initiative</fex> caused joyful excitement in Baku on Friday.
He met me with a glad <fex>face</fex>.
Armed officials marred the joyful <fex>mood</fex> at the recent Mon festival in Samut Sakhon.
I am helping them to have the joyful <fex>birth</fex> they want.
The Prime Minister expressed <fex>her sympathy for the victims</fex>.
True Manner: You should phrase it <fex>carefully</fex>.
Subsequent bomb alerts caused <fex>travel</fex>chaos in the London Underground.
More <fex>chaos</fex> awaits the Soviet Union unless it ditches perestroika for a Thatcherite purge of its economy.
Monica Lewinksy in 1998 gave him a rich new target, as did the electoral chaos <fex>of 2000</fex>.
Lying in bed listening to the chaos <fex>downstairs</fex>, he knew his conquest had only been temporary.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Maple Leaf Sports and Entertainment Ltd.
